column1: 18:34|So now I’m going to leave that old car standing on the tracks at Bridgeboro station
column2: because I have to go downstairs to supper. Oh
column4: I hope the six thirty-four express doesn’t come along and bump into it while I’m eating. I bet you’re all nervous and excited

column1: 18:34|It is around half past six in the evening. Dusk is gathering in the living room
column2: an early dusk due to the fog which has rolled in from the Sound and is like a white curtain drawn down outside the windows.|Long Day's Journey Into Night|Eugene O'Neill
